intro: Lepidagathis javanica var. brevispica, commonly known as the short-spined lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
